general.heading: 0. What’s the difference between design-only, dev-only, and design + development?
general.title1: Choose design-only if you just need visuals, dev-only if you already have designs, or full-service for a complete concept-to-launch solution.
list: Design-Only: Get Figma files, UX flows, branding, and responsive UI designs, ready for your dev team
Dev-Only: We build your product based on your provided designs, handling code, testing, and launch
Design + Development: End-to-end execution: strategy, design, development, QA, and deployment
general.title2: Example: Building a fintech dashboard from scratch? Full-service is ideal. Already have a design team? Go dev-only.

general.heading: 1. What’s the difference between hourly and fixed pricing?
general.title1: Hourly is flexible and pay-as-you-go. Fixed is predictable and best for scoped projects.
list: Hourly Pricing: Great for agile workflows and evolving scope. Billed transparently for actual time used.
Fixed Pricing: Ideal for clear, pre-scoped projects. One price, known deliverables, limited changes.
general.title2: Tip: If your features might grow or change, go hourly. For a defined landing page, fixed works best.

general.heading: 2. How long does it take to complete a project?
general.title1: 2–4 weeks for simple pages, 1–3 months for apps, 1–2 months for design systems.
list: Landing Pages or Small Websites: 2–4 weeks
Web & Mobile Apps: 1–3 months depending on features
Design Systems: 1–2 months with component planning + testing
general.title2: Example: A B2B onboarding app with 8 screens typically takes ~6 weeks.

general.heading: 3. Do you offer post-launch support?
general.title1: Yes, we stay with you beyond launch. Every project includes support for fixes and refinements.
list: Bug fixes and minor tweaks (free for X weeks/months)
Option to continue via monthly design/dev retainer
Ongoing consultation for optimization and iterations
general.title2: Tip: Most teams retain us after launch for maintenance and roadmap growth.

general.heading: 4. What’s included in a typical web or mobile app project?
general.title2: Deliverables: Design files, codebase, documentation, QA reports.

general.heading: 5. Can I change the scope once we start?
general.title1: Yes, we’re built for flexibility. Scope changes are common, and we support them without bottlenecks.
list: Additional features can be hourly or added to fixed quote
Clear change logs and approvals before execution
general.title2: Example: You add a new feature mid-project → we rescope and move forward.

general.heading: 6. How do I choose the right pricing model?
general.title1: If your scope is fixed, choose fixed. If evolving, choose hourly.
list: Fixed Pricing: Best for simple or one-time projects
Hourly Pricing: Ideal for product teams, founders iterating fast
general.title2: Still unsure? Book a call, we’ll recommend the best path.

general.heading: 7. What deliverables do I get with motion graphics?
general.title1: Storyboard + animated video files, optimized for your product.
general.title2: Use case: Animated onboarding, feature explainers, launch videos.

general.heading: 8. Can you set up a Design System and Component Library?
general.title1: Absolutely, that’s one of our specialties.
list: Design System: Colors, typography, layout rules
Component Library: Buttons, inputs, nav, cards, etc.
general.title2: Benefit: Scales faster, reduces rework, improves developer handoff.

general.heading: 9. What’s included in a UX Audit & Consultation?
general.title1: A deep review of your current UX with actionable fixes.
list: Friction points, usability issues, design flaws
general.title2: Outcome: A documented strategy you can apply instantly.

general.heading: 10. What do you offer in 3D animation and rendering projects?
general.title1: We take your idea from concept to stunning 3D visuals.
general.title2: Perfect for: Product showcases, promos, immersive site elements.

general.heading: 11. Can you work with my existing designs or wireframes?
general.title1: Yes, we’re happy to jump in midstream.
general.title2: Result: Time-saving with continuity and improved design quality.

general.heading: 12. How do I get started?
general.title1: Simple: Book a consultation or send us your brief, we’ll take it from there.
list: Start within 3–5 business days (depending on capacity)
general.title2: Getting in Touch: Click on “Contact Us” to book a call or reach out via WhatsApp.

general.heading: 13. How much does it cost to design a SaaS dashboard in 2025?
general.title1: $900–$2,000 USD depending on the scope, number of screens, and functionality.
list: MVP Dashboards: ~$900–$1,100 (6–8 screens, minimal features, basic UI/UX flows)
Mid-range Dashboards: ~$1,200–$1,600 (includes charts, auth flows, admin panels, responsive design)
Enterprise Dashboards: up to $2,000+ (advanced states, integrations, data visualizations, role-based access)
general.title2: Need a quote? Contact us with your product scope and we’ll send a custom proposal within 24 hours.

general.heading: 14. What tools and technologies do you use?
general.title1: We use Figma, Webflow, React, Tailwind, Lottie, and After Effects.
list: Lottie for motion, Storybook for handoff, Git for versioning
general.title2: Ask us for dev handoff examples or UI kit previews.

general.heading: 15. Do you work with startups and founders?
general.title1: Yes, we’re built for fast-moving startups.
list: Help with positioning, onboarding, growth UX
general.title2: We’ve worked with 25+ startups across AI, SaaS, fintech, and e-commerce.

general.heading: 16. Do you sign NDAs?
list: We’re happy to sign your NDA before sharing any details
Your product’s privacy and IP are always protected

general.heading: 17. Do you offer ongoing design support?
general.title2: Great for scaling teams who need consistent design quality.
